fields.headline: All made up
fields.bodyText: If you're the sort of wussy swimmer like me who has a fear of getting her face wet (it's the contact lenses, you know), then it'll be your hair and body that suffer most from regular chlorine dipping. A good hair protector pre-swim will save you from the ritual humiliation that is a swimming cap, and for this reason Kérastase's product receives the highest marks from the swimming fraternity. Honours must also go to the Joico range, which does a reasonable job of intimidating chlorine; and you have to love the sturdy Boots product - a three-in-one job will never be luxe, but at least it will minimise time spent in a scuzzy shower. More salubrious surroundings deserve a natural-smelling shower gel, and a generous helping of Bliss's drenching moisturiser will stop fishy scales from growing. Phine conditioner £7.40, by Joico, 01282 683100. 9/10 Sun, swim & gym shampoo 3 in 1 £2.99, by Boots, branches nationwide. 7/10 Give Me Energy bath and shower gel £13, by me mine, 01923 710710. 8/10 Creme Aqua Resist Soleil £13.10, by Kérastase, 0800 316 4400. 10/10 Lemon And Sage Body Butter £22, by Bliss, 0808 100 4151. 9/10
